definitions.definition: connected with God or a god; considered to be holy

examples.text: The place was sacred to the Apaches.
the feeling that all life should be held sacred

definitions.definition: very important and treated with great respect; that must not be changed or challenged

examples.text: Human life must always be sacred.
For journalists **nothing is sacred** *(= they write about anything)*.
Some companies offer five-year plans but there is nothing sacred about this length of time *(= it can be changed)*.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: past participle of archaic sacre ‘consecrate’, from Old French sacrer, from Latin sacrare, from sacer, sacr- ‘holy’.
